answers.answer: I bought new insoles for my most comfortable pair of shoes and compression socks. Even though I'm on my feet most of the 8 hours I'm at work I still make sure to sit down for a while whether anyone likes it or not. Then when I get home I prop my feet up on a pillow and try to stay off my feet as much as possible. It helps but I've noticed as long as I work on my feet all night, I'm going to get swollen. My doctor said it's just one of those things and as long as there aren't signs of preeclampsia then there's no need to worry. Just make yourself as comfortable as you can.

Well I'm 34-3 and I have the same problem I work 9 hours a day the only break I get is my day off...my friend at work suggested mommy socks..I've yet to try them but I suppose you could look them up. Best I got is good shoes and maybe some inserts when stand for long periods. And make sure to elevate your feet when you have time to relaxed cause all the blood goes to your feet when you stand for long periods.  Also try to keep up with blood pressure cause really bad swelling could mean high blood pressure and I'm sure you wouldn't want problems with that. Try soaking your feet as well in some warm water.

I had this a major problem with my 2nd that I retained more then just the normal swelling. Drink a lot of water and elevate the feet and compression  socks help. This is #3 and have had none to the most minimal  swelling and cut down on sodium. I swelled up with first but I can say I ate lot of stuff with salt. My 2nd I guess it was the way baby was in there  that  I was overflowed with water retention it hurt so much I could cry,from feet to hips.at delivery 3 epidurals  couldn't take and I was incontinent  for a week or so after trying to expelled the water. So I would never wish anyone that type of pain. It's horrible!! Walking also helps you need to just get good circulation  going.

question: I'm 35-4 weeks today my feet blew up drastically. It hurt to walk. My legs and fingers are swollen and my ankles do not look human anymore. My husband massaged them and soaked them but they still hurt and im still working. He jokingly said they look like midget feet which hurt my feelings a little because I feel helpless... Any advice???
title: BIG FAT SWOLLEN FEET
